# Text Display

**API Collection**

Display text and check spelling.

## Overview

In most cases, you can lay out your app’s text using the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextField] or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextView] classes (or their subclasses). Use the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextField] class to add either a label or a simple text input. Use the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextView] class to provide more comprehensive layout and editing features for larger bodies of text.

For example, [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextView] supports rich text, attachments (graphics, file, and other), input management and key binding, and marked text attributes. [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextView] works with the font panel and menu, rulers and paragraph styles, the Services facility (for example, the spell-checking service), and the pasteboard.

[doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextView] also allows customizing through delegation and notifications—you rarely need to subclass [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextView]. You rarely create instances of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextView] programmatically either, because objects on Interface Builder’s palettes, such as [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextField], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSForm], and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSScrollView], already contain [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextView] objects.

For even more powerful and more creative text manipulation (such as displaying text in a circle) see [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/textkit].

### Spell-checking

The [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSSpellServer] class lets you define a spell-checking service and provide it as a service to other apps. To connect your app to a spell-checking service, use the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSpellChecker] class. The [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSIgnoreMisspelledWords] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSChangeSpelling] protocols support the spell-checking mechanism.

## Text views

- **NSTextField**: Text the user can select or edit to send an action message to a target when the user presses the Return key.
- **NSTextFieldDelegate**: A protocol that a text field delegate can use to control its field editor action menu.
- **NSTextView**: A view that draws text and handles user interactions with that text.
- **NSTextViewDelegate**: A set of optional methods that text view delegates can use to manage selection, set text attributes, work with the spell checker, and more.
- **NSTextDelegate**: A set of optional methods implemented by the delegate of an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSText] object to edit text and change text formats.
- **NSText**: The most general programmatic interface for objects that manage text.

## Text input

- **Adopting the system text cursor in custom text views**: Incorporate the system text cursor into your custom text UI in AppKit.
- **NSTextInputContext**: An object that represents the Cocoa text input system.
- **NSTextInputClient**: A set of methods that text views need to implement to interact properly with the text input management system.
- **NSTextAlternatives**: A list of alternative strings for a piece of text.
- **NSTextContent**: A protocol that describes specific kinds of input content types.
- **NSTextInsertionIndicator**: A view that represents the insertion indicator in text.
- **NSTextInsertionIndicator.DisplayMode**: Constants that determine how to display the system text cursor in a custom text UI.
- **NSTextInsertionIndicator.AutomaticModeOptions**: Options that affect the automatic display mode.

## Text-checking

- **NSTextCheckingController**
- **NSTextCheckingClient**
- **NSTextInputTraits**
- **NSTextInputTraitType**

## Spell-checking

- **NSSpellChecker**: An interface to the Cocoa spell-checking service.
- **NSChangeSpelling**: A protocol that responder objects can implement to correct a misspelled word.
- **NSIgnoreMisspelledWords**: A protocol that enables the Ignore button in the Spelling panel to function properly.

## Deprecated

- **NSTextInput**: A set of methods that text views need to implement to interact properly with the text input management system.

## Text

- **TextKit**: Manage text storage and perform custom layout of text-based content in your app’s views.
- **Fonts**: Manage the fonts used to display text.
- **Writing Tools**: Add support for Writing Tools to your app’s text views.
